fields.description:
Currently, when an admin claims a domain on an instance, an email like the below is fired off to all users under that domain:
{quote}We're writing to let you know that your Atlassian account is now being managed by your Atlassian Cloud administrator.
This won't change the way you log in to Atlassian products or how you use them. However, from now on if you want to update your email address, you'll need to contact your Atlassian Cloud administrator. {quote}

As an admin, it'd be interesting to have the possibility of disabling those notifications to hundreds of users depending on the case, as users may not care about it.
fields.summary: Ability to disable notifications when domain is verified

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

According to the section "Deactivate or delete users" [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/invite-edit-and-remove-users-744721624.html#Invite,edit,andremoveusers-Deactivateordeleteusers], there is no way to bulk deactivate users.

We need the ability to read all active users in Atlassian Cloud and when necessary, deactivate/edit those Atlassian accounts.
h3. Suggested Solution
 - Implement an API solution for updating individuals and bulk updating users in mass
 - Allow the ability for the Atlassian Account to be synced with the Identity Provider account so that deactivation occurs automatically from either side

h3. Why this is important

As a Site-admin, it's not feasible to manually deactivate/edit accounts on an individual basis. The ability to bulk deactivate users in User Management is a necessary requirement

According to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/user-management-rest-api-changes-in-jira-cloud-858756548.html]
{quote}What options do I have for managing Atlassian accounts themselves via API?

Atlassian accounts cannot be managed via public APIs today. We are currently evaluating how best to expose these capabilities in a secure manner that best meets our customers' use cases.
{quote}
Our large software company constantly runs up against the # of users and we need a way to ensure our license usage is accurate. All we want is to Deactivate the user upon them leaving our company.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: Bulk Edit Atlassian Accounts in a Cloud Instance

fields.description: The add-on enhances the security of password usage. It would useful if Jira supports its usage.
fields.summary: Support the use of browser add-on Password Hasher Plus

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the new JIRA experience, the user management page has two ways to add a user:

Using the 'Invite user' button at the top right will invite the users but will not allow you to set their username and instead generates the username from their e-mail
Clicking the '+' from the left menu and selecting 'Invite user' allows you to invite a user and also set their username

h3. Suggested Solution

Show both options in the '+' menu and the Users page so admins are aware of the choices and can choose the one they want to use

h3. Why this is important

Sometimes admins need to be able to set the username whenever they create a new user account
fields.summary: New JIRA experience has two ways to invite users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
For companies that change their domain, the email address domain of the users needs to be manually changed.

h3. Suggested Solution
Possibility to change automatic the email address domain for selected users. 

E.g. get a user list, i.e. .csv, make the required changes and then upload it so assigned email addresses are automatic changed.

h3. Workaround 
For each user, the email address domain is manually changed.
fields.summary: Automatic change of the email address domain of the users

fields.description:
h3. Description:
 * When closing an Atlassian account, a spinning wheel is displayed but no confirmation message is ever displayed. If you check the browser console, an *Uncaught TypeError* is returned with the message:
{quote}
Uncaught TypeError: this.appConfig is not a function
{quote}
 *  !close account error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. When is the problem noticed?
 * Whenever closing any Atlassian account through https://id.atlassian.com/manage/close-account

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Navigate to https://id.atlassian.com and login using account credentials
 # Go to https://id.atlassian.com/manage/close-account, click the checkbox and click *Close account*
 # Check browser console 

*Note:* Even though no message is displayed, the account *is actually closed*. By refreshing the page, you will be logged out of your account.


*Note #2:* This bug is a duplicate of [ID\-6469: id.atlassian.com page hangs when trying to close account|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ID-6469]
fields.summary: When closing an Atlassian account, no message is returned

fields.description:
h3. Description:
 * When trying to close an Atlassian account, the error below is returned.
{quote}
Something went wrong while executing your request. Please try again later.
{quote}
  !Screen Shot 2018-01-09 at 12.23.52.png|thumbnail! 

h3. When is the problem noticed?
 * Apparently, all Atlassian accounts that have been created a while back present this problem

h3. When isn't the problem reproduced?
 * For recently created accounts, this issue is not reproducible.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Navigate to https://id.atlassian.com and login using account credentials
 # Go to https://id.atlassian.com/manage/close-account, click the checkbox and click *Close account*
 # Error is returned
fields.summary: Unable to Close an Atlassian Account

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When user's group-membership exceeds 30 (user is member of more than 30 groups), only the first 30 groups (alphabetically) are listed under "Groups" in the user's account in User Management.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add more than 30 different groups
# Assign a user to all groups
# Go to user's account in User Management (https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/admin/users/view?username=<username>)

h3. Expected Results
All the groups for which the user is member of, being listed under "Groups"

h3. Actual Results
Only first alphabetically 30 groups are listed
 
h3. Notes
There is no "Next" button/option to see the rest of group-memberships

h3.Workaround
Go to every group manually, to see if the user is a member of
fields.summary: User's groups (group-memberships) are not being listed completely in User Management

fields.description:
Currently the duration of an Atlassian Account Session token is non-configurable.

Several customers have expressed a desire to have this duration be modifiable, to be more in line with their security expectations.
fields.summary: Allow changing the duration of a session token

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no effective way to add G Suites users as customer accounts.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow to choose whether to sync the Google group as regular users or Service Desk customers.

h3. Why this is important
In some use case, admins would like to sync the employees as the customer accounts as the users do not work directly on JIRA projects.

h3. Workaround 
# Sync the users as regular process
# Remove all application access from the target users
#* Users without any application access will be treated as Service Desk customers
fields.summary: Ability to Sync Users as Customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users who are under SAML authentication still can use basic authentication when making REST API calls
h3. Suggested Solution

Prevent username/password non-interactive logins for managed users
h3. Why this is important

For customers, they are implementing 2FA for all of their users due to security concern. However, this 2FA can be bypassed when users are getting the data directly from REST API, where basic authentication is still allowed. In this context, their data is not exactly protected by the 2FA.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Prevent username/password non-interactive logins for managed users

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce
 * In /admin/groups, create a group with a long name (2850 characters seem to be sufficient, 2700 are not enough to trigger the bug). The group creation succeeds.
 * In the list of groups, click on the newly created group to see its description (or click on the cross in the right column to delete it).

h1. Expected result

The group detail view should appear.
h1. Actual result

The group detail view does not appear, and a 400 error shows in the console.

As a consequence, the group cannot be deleted.
fields.summary: Groups with long names cannot be deleted in /admin/groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users are not able to set up multiple SAML apps integration for one domain

h3. Suggestion
Allow multiple SAML apps integration for a domain

h3. Why is this important
Right now, users have to specify base URL for Jira and Confluence, and the SAML setup can only be done once. There are cases where users have multiple instances connected, and would like to have IDP-initiated log in for each of the instances.
fields.summary: Allow multiple SAML Apps integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Google login can still be used even when SAML integration for the domain is in place

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a google-backed email address
# Verify the domain and apply SAML integration for it
# try to login using Google

h3. Expected Results
* Login with Google doesn't work, as authentication should only be through SAML authentication

h3. Actual Results
* The login with Google works

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Users still able to login by Google even though SAML integration is in place

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Organization admins can not modify user account information such as full name and address until user's Atlassian Account is activated

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow organization admins to modify user data even without the Atlassian Account being activated

h3. Why this is important

Some users need to use the 'User Picker' custom field but can't search for specific users by their full name because it can't be edited
fields.summary: Organization admins can not modify user account information such as full name and address until user's Atlassian Account is activated

fields.description:
*Summary*
The ability to upload avatars for users by Site-admin. 

*Expected Results*
Having the upload avatar option to be uploaded by site-admin for all the users in the organization & security section.

*Actual Results*
There isn't an option to upload the avatar for the users in the organization & security section.
fields.summary: Allow Site-Admin to upload avatars for users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When user has "Zephyr Capture for Jira" add-on enabled in the browser, user will get "Oops, you've made a malformed request." message after logging in.

This message appears when there is a redirection (continue) appended at the login URL.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you are logged out
 # Try to access your instance (e.g. yourinstance.atlassian.net)
 # You'll be redirected to the following URL
 ** [https://id.atlassian.com/login?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fyourinstance.atlassian.net%2Flogin%3FredirectCount%3D1]
 # Try to login normally

h3. Expected Results

You'll be logged in normally
h3. Actual Results

You receive the following error message: Oops, you've made a malformed request.
h3. Notes

[JSON Modifier: JSONView 0.0.32.3|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/jsonview/chklaanhfefbnpoihckbnefhakgolnmc] may also trigger this error.

Without the redirection ([https://id.atlassian.com/login]), the login works fine.

This problem may occur with other extensions such as: [Link Redirect Trace|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/link-redirect-trace/nnpljppamoaalgkieeciijbcccohlpoh?utm_source=chrome-app-launcher-info-dialog]
h3. Workaround
 # Workaround 1: Turn off Zephyr Capture for Jira add-on
 # Workaround 2: Login to [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] first before proceeding to your instance
fields.summary: "Oops, you've made a malformed request." message thrown when logging in with Zephyr Capture for Jira enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* When users on Internet Explorer 11 try to log out from their Cloud site, they are redirected to the previous page they were on.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Click Log Out button of Cloud site from the navigation bar
# Clicks Log Out again to confirm. 

h3. Expected Results

* User logged out from Cloud and redirected to the login page.

h3. Actual Results

* This action takes the user back to the page they were on instead of logging them out properly.
fields.summary: Users unable to log out properly in Windows 7/IE 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The invite form in Internet Explorer is forcing to select a group when inviting the users. It's not possible to fill the rest of the form without adding a group, neither create the user.

h3. Environment
Reproduced on Internet Explorer version: 11.125.16299.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Internet Explorer access the User Management and click 'Invite Users'
# Try to fill the form without selecting a group
-  [^invite_user_IE.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The form allows you to fill the form and create the user without selecting a group

h3. Actual Results
The group drop-down menu keeps popping up and doesn't allow you to fill the other fields and create the user without selecting a group.

h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Groups field in the Invite user screen keeps popping up in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Add the option to single log out, from both the Cloud site and the Identity Provider with a SAML integration.
fields.summary: Implement Single Log Out for Cloud (SAML)

fields.description:
h2. Summary

In Safari 11, clicking on *Log out* does not log the user out. It redirects to the same page. 
h2. Expected Result

Clicking on *Log out* button should log the user out.
h2. Current Result

It is not logging user out.

 
h2. Workaround

Use other browsers, Chrome or IE or Firefox.
fields.summary: Can't logout in Safari 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Export Users doesn't allow to filter by 'Last Active' date

h3. Details
The *Export Users* function isn't currently allowing administrators to select a date range to filter users by their *Last Active* date.
However, the [documentation article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/export-users-833925313.html] says that it should be possible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to *Site Administration*
# Click *Export Users*

h3. Expected Behavior

A list with the items below should be displayed:

* Last session 
* Include in the export
* Only these groups

h3. Actual Behavior

A list with the items below is displayed instead:

* Include in the export
* Only these groups

h3. Workaround

No workaround known at this moment.
fields.summary: Export Users doesn't allow to filter by 'Last Active' date

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Today if a user decides to change his password on id.atlassian.com he has two fields, one with his current password and another field to input the new password, however, this can be prone to human errors since there is no field to check if the new password matches.

!Screen Shot 2017-12-05 at 12.45.38 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. *Suggestion*

Add another field to check if the passwords matches.
fields.summary: Add an additional field to check if password changes matches in Atlassian id

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Cloud User Management, you have four categories:
* Active Users
* Inactive Users
* System Users
* Pending Invitation

However, I am unable to find any documentation where we explain the difference. I recommend we create this documentation to explain to any users where this is not clear.
fields.summary: Explain difference between user categories in Cloud User Management

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Customers created in Jira before migration to Atlassian Account, had Local avatars, created before the user was associated with Atlassian Account. 

Since these avatars were not copied to the customer's Atlassian Account, they do not show in the 'Home' page ({{https://instance.atlassian.net/home}}), which shows an error getting the avatar from Gravatar in Browser.


h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access user profile page in 'Home'(new interface)
 # Instead of showing the Atlassian Account avatar or the avatar in Jira, it shows the default avatar.

 
h2. Expected Results


 Show the correct Avatar

 
h2. Actual Results


 It shows the default avatar(none).

 
h2. Workaround

Set an avatar in Atlassian Account through [https://id.atlassian.com/]
fields.summary: Local avatars are not being shown

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently when a Cloud domain is using Atlassian ID, there is no maximum login attempts, only the Captcha that is offered after 10 failed attempts.
Also, our Server versions of software offer a way to turn this on in General Configuration.

h3. Suggested Solution
If a user has a managed domain, offer them the ability to set "maximum login attempts" as part of their password policy. Optionally, within the new Identity Manager

h3. Why this is important
For better security within the system
 
h3. Workaround 
Using SAML with Cloud may offer maximum login attempts depending on the provider.
fields.summary: Include maximum login attempts as a setting for managed domains

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Security keys are hardware devices that you can use as your two-step verification. Instead of typing a verification code every time you sign in, you insert the security key and press a button on the device.

h4. Suggestion

This functionality is already available for BitBucket, it would be great if it was made available for Atlassian Accounts as well, since we are on track for 2FA there as well.
fields.summary: Add FIDO U2F security key support to Atlassian Accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Atlassian Cloud support [22 languages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/languages-744721667.html], but Identity services do not. The following services/features should be translated into languages other than English:
 * Login
 * User Management
 * Migrate to Atlassian account (portal customers)
 * Invitation, verification and password reset emails.
 ** Invitation/Verification emails is *the first email* that our users get from Atlassian

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Offer language packs for Identity services.

h3. Why this is important
 * Atlassian supports language packs, so verification, password reset and invitation emails should also support multiple languages.
 * User Managment should also support multiple languages.
 * Multi-language support for Identity Services is critical to provide our customers unified localized user experience.
 * Identity Serivces should keep user's language preference in addition to Country and Timezone.
 * All applications can refer to user's language preference in the following order, recommendation :
 -- Site preference (user can set it as detecting browser setting automatically, auto-detection should be default)
 -- Browser preference
 -- Identity Service preference - keep user's language preference across our services, also used for product agnostic services like transaction emails, newsletter etc.
 -- Site default language.

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds.
fields.summary: Multi-language support for Identity services, emails and User Management

fields.description:
h3. Current Situation

At the moment, whenever a G-Suite integration is established in an Atlassian Cloud product, all the domains listed in that G-Suite will have to login through G-Suite.

h3. Suggestion

Allow the admin to choose which domain to claim from G-Suite list

h3. Why is this important

Consider this scenario:
* A company has 2 domains for different set of users, domain abc.com and xyz.com
* abc.com is connected with G-Suite and users are using Google account
* xyz.com is connected to Azure AD and users are using Microsoft account

If xyz.com is added to G-suite (with intention of creating alias *only*), all users under xyz.com will be forced to login through G-Suite as it as the domain is claimed when added to G-Suite.
fields.summary: Ability to choose which domain to claim through G-Suite

fields.description:
h3. Current Situation
When logging in through id.atlassian.com, users have 2 options:
# login using Google ID
# login using email address
## If there is no SAML associated to the domain of the email, password textbox will appear
## If there is SAML associated to the domain of the email, redirected to SSO provider

h3. Suggestion
Add a third options: "Login with work email" like in the attachment

h3. Why is this important
at times non-technical people (sales, HR, etc) have for one reason or another use Jira/confluence and they are thrown off by the login screen. If there is a "call for action" for logging in with work related email, it will be easier for such users
fields.summary: Improve login page of id.atlassian.com by adding option for logging in with SAML-SSO email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is not possible to use a pseudonym or a nickname when it comes to public facing Atlassian sites (Community, public bug tracker) as it automatically links to their Atlassian Account, showing the full name. This makes it show up publicly on the internet, including the account image. This can cause security concerns such as impersonation or identity theft.

h3. Suggested Solution

Have a multi-tenant system of the Atlassian account management, so that users can choose their own public-facing username to remain anonymous while still being able to use other Atlassian accounts under their real name
fields.summary: Allow users to display different names in different Atlassian sites

fields.description:
On documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-groups-744721627.html it says that users who have administrators group has site administration permission as well, which is wrong.

This information should be removed:

{quote}
Users with this permission are considered site administrators for documentation and Support purposes, and they have access to all the applications in the site.
{quote}

Thanks.

Best regards,
Angélica Luz
Atlassian Support | Cloud
fields.summary: Incorret information on documentation

fields.description:
{panel:title=Resolution Update}
Hi,

We recently released an improved version of the G Suite integration, as part of Atlassian Access, that supports syncing G Suite groups. Learn all about the changes in this blog post.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2020/10/were-changing-g-suite-settings-and-giving-you-a-free-upgrade-for-6-months]

Thank you,

Narmada Jayasankar

Lead Product Manager, Atlassian Access
{panel}
h3. Current situation

At the moment, there can only one default configuration when we create users through G-Suite sync. This default configuration is set in the Application Access configuration in Atlassian's User Management panel.
h3. Suggestion

When syncing G-Suite, allow admin to configure or map a G-Suite Group to a specific application access (JIRA or Confluence or Both)
h3. Why this is important?

When we are syncing users from G-Suite group with multiple groups, it would be really handy if we can define which G-Suite group has access to which app. This is because users have different needs (JIRA, Confluence, or both). At the moment, we had to change this manually, which can be a hassle for large amount of users.
fields.summary: Improve Default Application Access Configuration for G-Suite Integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
New user sessions are unable to access Cloud products getting a TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS error message instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to access either Jira or Confluence with a new user account.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence and/or Jira is reached properly.

h3. Actual Results
Users are getting a TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS error message followed by a _Your operation is taking longer than usual_ message and cannot access Jira or Confluence.

h3. Notes
Because the automatic sync is failing, newly created groups will not be shown in Jira or Confluence as well.
 
h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: New user session cannot access Jira or Confluence

fields.description:
It is more intuitive to also include the "user id" in the ["Manage your account"|https://id.atlassian.com/manage/account-settings] page instead of just the avatar to discount for scenarios such as Users having multiple accounts and system administrators wanting to delete users at  https://id.atlassian.com/manage/close-account.

 !Screenshot from 2017-11-02 11.39.38.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add user name under Avatar in "Manage your account" page at id.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h2. *Current Behaviour*

At the moment SingleLogoutService URL in SAML is not supported

h2. *Requested Behaviour*

Support IdP that require user to specify SingleLogoutService URL in order to setup SAML
fields.summary: Support SingleLogoutService URL in SAML

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the New JIRA experience, the JIRA home button at the top left corner will lead to <instance-name>.atlassian.net .
This becomes an issue when the instance has both JIRA and Confluence, and under Application access -> User defaults, the Homepage is set to Confluence. In this case, *Clicking on the JIRA Home icon would redirect the user to the Confluence home* (<instance-name>.atlassian.net/wiki), instead of to the JIRA Home. 

h3. Environment
* Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure the instance has both, JIRA and Confluence.
# Under Application Access -> User defaults, set the Homepage to Confluence.
# Enable the New Experience.
# Go to <instance-name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa , and click on the JIRA Home icon at the top left corner.

h3. Expected Results
The user will be redirected to JIRA Home.

h3. Actual Results
The user is redirected to Confluence Home.

h3. Notes
This should be fixed by changing the URL of the JIRA Home icon to <instance-name>.atlassian.net/secure/MyJiraHome.jspa , which is the behavior when using the Old UI.

h3. Workaround
Use the Old UI by clicking on the Profile icon at the bottom left of the page, and select "Turn off for now".
fields.summary: Clicking on the JIRA Home Icon leads to Confluence Homepage on the New Experience

fields.description:
Users with personal account (not managed) can update their email address and continue to access the site with their updated email address. Admins cannot prevent users from updating the email address if they have not claimed the domain.

Suggestion:

Send an email to all Admins when any un-managed user update their email address.
fields.summary: Notify admins when users update their email address

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

If a particular domain is integrated with G Suite other users pertaining to that domain will be forced to log in using Google but since they are not managed by G Suite they will be unable to log in.

h3. *Suggestion*

Provide a toggle option for site-admins to enable the enforcement of Google login or not.

h3. *Workaround*

A password reset request through [Atlassian ID|https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword] will also send a passwordless link so the user can enter his/her application.
fields.summary: Improve how non-G Suite accounts logs into id.atlassian.com

fields.description:
All but one of the "Related Content" links at <https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/integrate-with-g-suite-744721642.html> are broken.

* "G Suite options for sites using Atlassian account"
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/G+Suite+options+for+sites+using+Atlassian+account
* "Manage users without group-based syncing"
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Manage+users+without+group-based+syncing 
* "Upcoming changes to G Suite integrations"
**  https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Upcoming+changes+to+G+Suite+integrations 
 
The only link that _do_ work is "Authentication": https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Authentication.
fields.summary: Integrate with G Suite documentation links broken

fields.description:
h3. Current Situation

At the moment, users are not supposed to logged out once they reached the day-limit of Authentication Policies, as Authentication Policies are only checked on authentication.

Therefore, even if they have exceeded the password expiry date (e.g. 90 days), as long as they haven't logged out, they won't be prompted to set a new password.

The thing is, both Admins and Users are not aware if they have reached the limit, as the user are mostly logged in all the time and the cookie kept getting renewed.

h3. Solution

Send a notification to an Admin if a user haven't change their password after it reached the expiry limit, or force logged out the users so that they have to reset their password
fields.summary: Notify Admin or the user if they have reached the password expiry limit set in Authentication Policies

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With the introduction of PUP(per user pricing), site-admins require a way to automate the reporting process

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow Jira email server to send email reporting on users who haven't logged in for a configurable amount of time
* Provide some method of allowing site-admins to be alerted when a user hasn't logged in after a customizable time limit
* Allow site-admins to specify a time limit in which a user account is set to "inactive" if the user has not logged in within the specified time limit

h3. Why this is important
* Site-admins need to keep license counts as low as possible so they are not billed for users that are not required
* Manually checking can be very time consuming(especially with a large user base)

 
h3. Workaround 
* User Management has an "Export Users" feature which allows site-admins to download a CSV containing last access data
fields.summary: Automated reporting of last active timestamp

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to close account via _id.atlassian.com_, nothing happens and page hangs.

However account is removed after some time as it should.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Login to _id.atlassian.com_

2. Use the following link to close account:
 [https://id.atlassian.com/manage/close-account]
h3. Expected Results

 

There should be some confirmation that account is deleted

 
h3. Actual Results

Account is deleted, however:
 # There is no confirmation that account is deleted
 # "Close account" page just hangs
 # Error "Uncaught TypeError: this.appConfig is not a function" in console of the browser
fields.summary: id.atlassian.com page hangs when trying to close account

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pending Invitation filter isn't showing any results even after have users invited. The users were invited to the instance and never logged in, they have the 'Resend' link to resend the invite, however, they still aren't shown in the 'Pending Invitation' filter making difficult to track these users since they're shown together with the Active Users filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Invite a new user to the instance
# Select the 'Pending Invitation' filter

h3. Expected Results
The filter should list all the users that has been invited to the instance and haven't never logged in.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is shown under the 'Pending Invitation' filter.
 
h3.Workaround
Export the users to CSV and filter the users that have never logged in.
fields.summary: Pending Invitation filter doesn't show any result even with invited users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you have more than one OnDemand product like JIRA and Confluence and there are admin users with the application access for both applications, by removing the Confluence Application Access the user will automatically be removed from the _administrators_ and _site-admins_ groups.
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a test user (UserTest) with JIRA and Confluence applications access.
 # Add the UserTest into the administrators and site-admins groups.
 # Remove the Confluence Application Access for UserTest user.

h3. Expected Results

The user should be removed from the confluence-users group only, as the user has JIRA application access and JIRA application access has the groups site-admins and administrators.

If this user is a JIRA admin, this user should not be removed from this group.
h3. Actual Results

The user is removed from the administrators and site-admins groups.
h3. Notes

There is this Feature request https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59222 in order to request _"Add warning when removing Application Access about removal of all groups"_
h3. Workaround

When removing access, remove the corresponding groups(like confluence-users or jira-servicedesk-users) instead of using the checkboxes for each products.
fields.summary: When some application access is removed, it also removes the administrators and site-admins groups if they are shared groups

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On the SAML configuration page in *SAML administration*, the link to the configuration documentation for SAML is invalid.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on link below
{quote}SAML is currently in open Beta. Features are production-ready, but will one day form part of a Premium edition for Atlassian products at additional cost. Read our Legal terms covering Beta trials such as this at Section 11 of the Atlassian Customer Agreement. We suggest reading our [configuration documentation for SAML|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/bJlCMw] before saving a configuration.
{quote}

h3. Expected Results
 * The correct document is shown.

h3. Actual Results
 * A bank screen is shown.

h3. Notes
* None.

h3. Workaround
 * The correct document is [SAML single sign-on|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-873871238.html].
fields.summary: SAML configuration documentation link is invalid

fields.description:
Recent changes have caused a new prompt to show whenever creating a new user account asking if we want to enable self sign up for the domain of the user that was just created.

The admin has specifically disabled self sign ups for a reason and do not want to keep being prompted to enable self sign ups.
fields.summary: As an admin, do not prompt me to allow self sign up for a domain when I have self sign up disabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With a domain verified, using the *Reset passwords now* option in the *Password Policy* menu will reset passwords for all users on the verified domain but an error is displayed on the user interface once the operation completes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you have a domain verified and users from that domain on your Cloud instance.
# In the *Password Policy* menu, use the *Reset passwords now* option.

h3. Expected Results
Passwords are reset for users of the verified domains without issues.

h3. Actual Results
Passwords are reset for users of the verified domains but the following error is displayed on the user interface:
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-04 at 17.08.06.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
None. The error message has no impact.
fields.summary: Reset passwords now feature is throwing an error message on the interface when used

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Currently, when creating a user, after entering the email, a Self-Signup field will appear autocompleted with the domain.
If mistakenly left unchecked it can create a security problem.

*Note:* If the domain is deleted, it will not show again in the future.
More information at: [Invite, edit, and remove users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/invite-edit-and-remove-users-744721624.html]

The field in the invite users screen is not the only way to add domains as they can be added and edited in the self-signup section.


h3. Suggested Resolution
Have the ability to permanently hide the field, or make it unchecked by default to prevent mistakes.

Adding domains is not a regular activity done by site-admins so having it in the create users screen seems that it can create more problems than benefits to admins.
fields.summary: Have the ability to configure the Self Signup while creating Users

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As described in [SAML single sign-on|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-873871238.html#SAMLsinglesign-on-1.AddtheAtlassianapplicationtoyourIdP], currently SAML attribute mappings require *givenname* and *surname*. Then Atlassian account concatenates them to form the full name in western name order. This name order is unnatural to users mainly in East Asian countries.
 cf. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_name#Name_order]
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Support attribute for full name such as [http://schemas.microsoft.com/identity/claims/displayname]
 * Make it able to select name order

h3. Workaround
None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Support eastern name order in SAML

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The reset password email does not come with an identifier of the source instance who triggered it.
The email has only the name of the administrator who sent the email. Here's an example:
!Capture 2017-09-02 at 17.35.25.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Similar to administrator's name, add the name of the instance where the reset is coming from, for example:
{noformat}
Hello <user>,

Your administrator, <admin-name> from <instance-name.atlassian.net> requests you to change the password for your Atlassian account:
<user-email-address>
{noformat}

h3. Why this is important
It's understandable the users can access multiple accounts with the Atlassian account, but inserting the name of the instance who triggered the email would be helpful to navigate back and access the required instance.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Add the instance name on the password reset email

fields.description: Allow a Site Administrator to assign a user label or "name" that will be displayed alongside the user's full name only in that specific site.
fields.summary: Allow a site-specific name for an account

fields.description:
{panel:title=An update on switching between Atlassian accounts}
The ability to switch accounts is currently available in Trello, Bitbucket, id.atlassian.com and my.atlassian.com, with more products to follow soon!

On (2) outlined below, we are making good progress and hope to have more info / timelines to share soon. 

 
----
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your patience with us on this request. 

We have some exciting things planned in this space on our short-term roadmap over the coming few months:
 # Support the ability to switch accounts in our global products (i.e. non-tenanted products like Trello, Bitbucket, Statuspage, Start, etc.). This will allow you to easily switch your account in these products without having to log out, or use a different browser.
 # Support the ability to be logged into different domains (including different Jira and Confluence sites) with different accounts. With this, you'll be able to be logged into Bitbucket with account A, acme.atlassian.net with account B, and space.atlassian.net with account C.

To help make sure we've addressed the main use cases for multiple accounts/switching accounts, I'd love your help with [answering this short survey|https://forms.gle/B9VmLrriyQ9iDDVB7]. It should take no longer than 2 minutes to complete, and will be super useful in helping us understand whether there's any gaps in our plan. 

If you have any questions about anything, or would like to chat more about your use case, feel free to send me an email at [ayang@atlassian.com|mailto:ayang@atlassian.com].

Thanks in advance! 

Cheers,
Aneita
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition
 * Users who have more than one Atlassian Account for different environments could have an easier way to switch between these accounts

 (Example: switching between google mail)

 
h3. Why this is important
 * Help users that constantly need to switch between Atlassian Accounts 

h3. Workaround
 * Go to [https://id.atlassian.com/login/select-account] and choose the account you want to login with (up to 10 accounts)
 * Use different browsers for each account
 * Access different account using incognito window
fields.summary: Easily switch between Atlassian Accounts

fields.description:
*Summary*

At the moment, in the line of the feature request [CLOUD-9968|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-9968], having multiple Atlassian Accounts, it is not possible to easily see which account I am logged in.

*Suggestion*

As a user, it would be great having the information which account I am currently logged in under the avatar profile picture without opening the profile page. 

!CLOUD-10022.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Easily see which Atlassian account I am logged in.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
||User Profile Page||Group Page||
| !UserProfile.png|thumbnail!| !GroupPage.png|thumbnail!|

At present, the member count is displayed on a group page, but groups listed on a user's profile page is not displayed.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add group membership count data to the user profile page.

h3. Why this is important
* Allows admins to more easily manage their users.
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workaround.
fields.summary: User Profile Page: group membership counter

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently when we create a user, automatically an Atlassian account is created, even though the user hasn't confirmed the email.
Then if the user goes to the instance URL and tries to create the account, he/she receive an email informing that an Atlassian account already exists for that email address, and he/she must reset the password that was not even created.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if the Atlassian account is created only when the user finishes the registration through instance URL.
fields.summary: Allow users to finish the Atlassian account creation without the invitation email

fields.description:
An API to retrieve a users profile details by user ID on api.atlassian.com was added to help facilitate the Stride ecosystem integrations (e.g. Addons, Bots etc).

https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/stride/learning/getting-user-details/

A common integration is to have some action in a third party system trigger a mention in a Stride room. This requires finding the associated user to mention in Stride. However as the Identity Providers are different between the two systems, the IDs for the user are different and the user ID is required to mention someone. As a result, integrators want to map users by email address but no such API exists
fields.summary: Allow for a user to be resolved by email address using api.atlassian.com

fields.description:
With the introduction of 2-Step Login enforcement for an Organisation an Organisation administrator can enforce 2-Step Login across all of their managed accounts. There are however no tools for a Site Administrator to enforce a policy on accounts accessing their content.

By allowing the enforcing of 2-Step login on content we would allow Site Administrators to mandate that 2-Step Login be enabled on any account that is granted access to their content.
fields.summary: Allow the enforcing of 2-Step Login on a Site or on Content

fields.description:
In order to reduce the friction of creating an Organisation it would be good to allow the verification of a domain based on the ability to respond to an email sent to an email address on that domain.

Whilst this is somewhat less secure than a complete domain verification process, it would allow an administrator to begin the setup of a domain and potentially enforce some basic domain based policies (e.g., Password Policy).
fields.summary: Allow email based domain verification for basic identity management

fields.description:
In order to assist Site Administrators in understanding who belongs to a particular organisation it would be good to show the name of the organisation appended after the account name within User Management.

E.g., Mike Fitzbaxter [Atlassian]

This would assist Site Administrators in understanding which accounts are secure and which accounts to suggest enable 2-Step login.
fields.summary: Show the name of an accounts' organisation next to the account name in Site Admin

fields.description:
In order to assist Site Administrators in protecting their content it would be good to show the type of authentication policy applied to an account when viewing the accounts inside User Management.

Ideally this should show status such as:
 * 2-Step login enabled on account
 * SAML policy enforced
fields.summary: Show the type of authentication enabled on an Atlassian account within Site Admin

fields.description:
h2. *Current Behaviour*

User will receive an invite when the user is created via REST API
h2. *Requested Behaviour*

It would great to have feature to disable the invites when creating users via API. Perhaps we can have a parameter for it. Currently we have an option to disable JIRA outgoing mail server. But this is very deceptive as it doesn't actually disable the invitation mail but just limited to JIRA outgoing mail. It would also be nice to mention what is being disabled and what not.
fields.summary: Allow user to disable the invitation mail when creating a user via REST API

fields.description:
As a site administrator, I want to suggest profile field changes for a Personal Atlassian account on my site. The user could either accept or decline my request easily.

Admin can suggest their unmanaged users to update their Full name, Email address.
fields.summary: Allow site admin to suggest profile field changes on a Personal Atlassian account

fields.description: As an admin, if I misspell an email address, I should be able to correct it without having to complete a domain verification on the domain that was entered into the invite. Particularly if this email address doesn't exist, and can never be verified or used.
fields.summary: Allow correction of misspelled email addresses

fields.description: As an administrator, I would like to secure the content on my site with two-step verification for all users, irrespective of whether they are managed or personal accounts.
fields.summary: Mandate two-step verification across a site

fields.description: Customers would like a list of all applications their Atlassian Account has access to showing when they log in at [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] - This will help cut down on confusion regarding what applications the Atlassian Account has access to
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have links to various applications that I have access to in id.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently only GSuite syncs username/email to Atlassian Account.
h3. Suggested Solution

To improve usability, users would like to sync further information, such as contact phone, job title, IM, etc.
fields.summary: Sync additional information to Atlassian Account using GSuite

fields.description:
h3. Current Situation

When we export user details using the "Export Users" function, we can't get their phone number even if we can specify them in our profile

h3. Suggestion

Please include phone numbers in the csv when we use the "Export Users" function
fields.summary: Include Phone Numbers for "Export Users" Function

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Administrators are unable to set the password policy for users who are not on a claimed domain. Users who are not on a claimed domain will default weak password policy. This could violate the corporate password policy requirements for application access for some users.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow administrators to set the password policy of all users irrespective of whether the domain is claimed or not.
fields.summary: Allow an administrator to set the password policy for users not on a claimed domain

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an admin click on _"Log in as user"_ under User Management, it updates the Last Active of the user.
h3. Affected Version
 - JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the cog icon  !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/157679812/Cog.png! on the right top menu > User Management
 # Click on a user
 # Click on _"Log in as User"_

h3. Expected Results

User's last active *is not* updated.

h3. Actual Results

User's last active *is* updated.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Clicking on "Log in as user" under User Management, it updates the Last Active of the user.

fields.description: Some customers use other services that requires the TXT @ Record, due to that, they are unable to add Atlassian DNS record to verify their domain.
fields.summary: Custom Name for DNS Record

fields.description:
An API token:
{quote}allows you to access JIRA REST APIs.
{quote}
However, Confluence isn't supported. It would be good to have the same level of support for Confluence, so a single token can be used across both products.
fields.summary: Support API tokens for Confluence cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If we create a user in User Management taking license seats with username 'sysadmin', it won't show in Application Access users list (under {{Users with access}}) for any of the applications it's a part of.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user with username 'sysadmin'
# Add it to some (or all) Application Access
# Check the Application Access user list for this user
# Change it's username to, say, 'sysadmin1' (do not change Application Access or groups membership)
# Check the list again

h3. Expected Results
The user is shown in list in both cases, as it has Application Access in both cases.

h3. Actual Results
The user will not show in list when its username is 'sysadmin', but it will show when it has a different username.

h3. Notes
The user still counts towards license and the 'license usage' will still count this user. This may be confusing as, for example, the license usage may say '10 users' but the user list will only show 9 users with access (apart from system users).

h3.Workaround
If necessary, change username and user will be shown in list.
fields.summary: Users with username 'sysadmin' don't show in Application Access users list

fields.description:
h3. Summary

New users invited in Atlassian Cloud applications that use SAML integration are not automatically logged after clicking on the invite link.

They are redirected to the application page but they need to click on the "Log in" button on the far right upper corner.

!Screen Shot 2017-09-05 at 11.40.34 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Description

When a new user receives an invite from an Atlassian Cloud application the email redirects him to our [Atlassian Account identity portal|https://id.atlassian.com/], then they need to create a new password after that they are redirected to the instance URL,however, they are not promptly logged they need to click on the upper right button "Log in" which does not seem to load the application, leaving a blank page, new users need to close their browser and re-open it in order to be logged in.

This is an annoyance, especially for new users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an instance with SAML set up
 # Provision a new user
 # User receives the invite, clicks on the link is redirected to id.atlassian.com. The user's email address is pre-filled and there is a field for entering the password. Entering a password will not work here as the user needs to authenticate via their SAML login portal.

h3. Expected Result

User should be directed to log into their Atlassian account by authenticating via their SAML login portal.
h3. Actual Result

User is prompted to enter a password into the id.atlassian.com page instead of going to their SAML login portal. There is no easy way for users to progress to their SAML login portal from the id.atlassian.com screen.
h3. Workaround

Go directly to [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] type your federated email, you will be redirected to your SAML login portal after that you can click on the invite link.
fields.summary: New site invites don't work with SAML users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

At the moment, whenever we integrate G-Suite with Atlassian Cloud, every users under the domain will receive notification email.

h3. Use-Case

There are some occasions where we don't want to send notifications to everyone. There isn't enough control and not all users should receive this notification (eg. executives).

h3. Suggestion

Allow disabling of email notification that was sent after G-suite integration

h3. Work around

The only current workaround for this behavior is to not integrate with G Suite. Users provisioned via any other supported identity provider (including a [Google Cloud method|https://support.atlassian.com/provisioning-users/docs/configure-user-provisioning-with-google-cloud/] that is separate from the G Suite integration) will not cause newly provisioned users to receive emails.
fields.summary: Allow admin to disable notification emails that were sent after G-Suite integration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When there's an issue with the domain claim, such as a missing token, etc. The email goes out once every single day and the email says that this will continue for 14 days.

This can be really annoying especially since there's no quick way to disable it from within the email.

h3. Suggested Solution
Perhaps only send the email once every 2-3 days, or provide an option to either:
# Completely disable the email, with one final reminder before the domain is disabled
# Be able to remove the domain by clicking a link in the email which would then be redirected to the administrator panel and remove the domain.

h3. Why this is important
Reducing the number of emails we send to customers
fields.summary: Too many emails about warning about domain claim

fields.description: It would be great to have passwords pre-filled by password managers like 1password.
fields.summary: Improve support for 1password

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to add user to a group In case the group name is 'confluence-administrators'.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a group whose name is 'confluence-administrators'
# Try to add users to the group

h3. Expected Results

The users should be added to the group as expected. Otherwise, the application should prevent 'confluence-administrators' group from being created as reserved word with showing the alert message.

h3. Actual Results

We can create 'confluence-administrators' group even though we can't add users to the group.

h3.Workaround

Use other group name instead.
fields.summary: Unable to add user to a group In case the group name is 'confluence-administrators'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * In User Management, there is display limit of 30 groups on the user profile page.
 * There aren't any options to allow a list of groups a user is a member of to span across multiple pages.

 

Example: This user is a member of 35+ groups, but only 30 groups are visible.

!Screen Shot 2017-09-01 at 9.24.30 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Add a "Next Page" button - this is already done on the Groups page within User Management, but this feature is not available on the user profile page.

h3. Why this is important
 * Some users are a member of more than 30 groups.
 * Not having this feature creates more work for the JIRA/Confluence Admin.

h3. Workaround
 * No workarounds at this current point in time.
fields.summary: User account profile: display all groups a user is a member of

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to customize JIRA login page. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide ability to customize JIRA login page.
fields.summary: Ability to customize JIRA login page

fields.description:
h3. Provide a better mail delivery management log/tool for administrators.

It could be useful for some administrators to be able to see if their Reset Passwords / Invitation messages were successfully delivered to users on their instance. Also, for the ones that weren't delivered, enable administrators to reset failed delivery attempts.
fields.summary: Provide a better mail delivery management log/tool for administrators.

fields.description:
The link [https://instance_name.atlassian.net/login/forgot] is still available in some Cloud instances, however, when trying to reset the password, you receive the following message: "We were unable to reset your password as your account may have been deactivated. Please speak to your administrator."

 !Screen Shot 2017-08-30 at 15.18.47.png|thumbnail! 

That page should no longer be displayed if it doesn't work anymore.
fields.summary: Remove the page https://instance_name.atlassian.net/login/forgot from Cloud instances

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * A JIRA admin gives a contractor edit access to JIRA
 * That contractor leaves, but there is a need to retain user contributions when there is a change in account ownership
 * Often, the contractor's email address is on a domain the JIRA admin doesn't have control of

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Give JIRA admins the ability to reassociate JIRA account email addresses with a different Atlassian ID

h3. Why this is important
 * Creates friction as it's not always possible for the outgoing contractor to log into [id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/] and change the email address to that of the new contractor
 * JIRA admins require a way to update the JIRA email address without any action from the end user

h3. Workaround
 * Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] for assistance
 * Reference this Feature Request(ID-6419) in the Support Request
fields.summary: Allow JIRA admin to update the email address(domain verification not possible)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Currently, with *Atlassian Account*, user creation form does not have fields to define the *Full Name* and *Username* for a user.

It's no longer possible to define the *Full Name* and *Username*, when navigating to a hidden URL:
 * [https://INSTANCE_NAME.atlassian.net/admin/users/add|https://instance_name.atlassian.net/admin/users/add]

h3. Suggested Resolution

Reintroduce the ability to suggest a Full Name, and specify a username as part of the inviting of a user to a site.
fields.summary: Have an option to create users with the ability to suggest Full Name, and specify Username

fields.description:
Administrators don't have a way of changing the user's full name. 

However If you are using Atlassian Account and need to change a user's full name; You can ask the user to log on to id.atlassian.com and change the name in the Profile. This change will then reflect in JIRA. 

*Note* - You will need to logout and log back into id.atlassian.com and then JIRA to see the updated name
{panel:title=Changes to what site administrators can and can't do}
The Atlassian Cloud Identity Platform has recently undergone significant changes to enable users to seamlessly move across Atlassian Cloud products (specifically Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Stride). As a result, Site Administrators will experience changes in the level of control they have over cloud users. We understand these changes can be difficult, below I'll provide additional details to help you through this transition. Our ultimate goal is to make it easier for users to move between systems and collaborate together.

The following is now true for all cloud sites and users:
 * *Cloud users own their own accounts*
 * Cloud Atlassian accounts are global, allowing users access to all Atlassian Cloud products including Bitbucket, Stride, Jira, and Confluence
 * User account information (including full name and avatar) should *now be global and consistent* on all cloud sites and products, ensuring any changes to user account information will be reflected in all sites and products that users can access

For the reasons stated above, we’re implementing changes to what Site Administrators can and can’t do:
 * Site Administrators can _invite_ any user to contribute to their site or revoke user access to their content

 * Invited users who do not already have an Atlassian account are prompted to create their account
 * Site Administrators can no longer create, manage, or edit accounts

To support customers with specific security requirements you can now [claim an email domain|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-domains-868983095.html] and manage all the accounts with an email address belonging to that domain. Claiming an email domain creates an _*Organization*_ (available in the upcoming Identity Manager release) comprising all accounts who belong to that claimed domain.

Organization administrators _can_:
 * Change a managed account's full name
 * Change a managed account's avatar
 * Update a managed account's email address
 * Enforce a password policy on managed accounts
 * Apply a SAML login policy to all managed accounts across cloud sites and products
 * Delete a managed account

An organization administrator _can't:_
 * control a managed user's access to a site or product — that is done by the owner / site administrator of each individual site

*Next steps:*

If you need the ability to manage your organization's user accounts, we encourage you to [verify your domain and set up an Organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-domains-868983095.html] within the Atlassian Cloud identity platform. As an organization administrator, you’ll have the ability to manage all user accounts within your organization and any changes you make will apply across all Atlassian Cloud sites and products.

If you have users accessing your cloud content from other organizations, you should encourage those organizations to claim and manage their staff's accounts to apply any policies they feel are important to them. You can manage any accounts' access to your content if you're still concerned about the policy applying to those accounts.

*Feature requests we're considering that relate to this change* *(please vote and watch those that are relevant to you):* 
 * ID-6448 - Show the name of an accounts' organisation next to the account name in Site Admin
 * ID-6447 - Show the type of authentication enabled on an Atlassian account within Site Admin
 * ID-6443 - Allow site admin to suggest profile field changes on a Personal Atlassian account
 * ID-6237 - Allow admin of managed account to change users avatar
 * ID-6457 - Allow a site-specific name for an account
{panel}
fields.summary: Can't change user's full name

fields.description:
Currently, there are no options for Administrators to automate the change (or signal the change) of email domain for JIRA/Confluence cloud and Atlassian Accounts.

Ideally, there would be a streamlined process that will signal to Atlassian Account that there is a change if the email domain to be used by users. Signaling to end-users to choose to use the new email as the new email for their Atlassian Account, or to create a new one, with details on the instance that called for the change.
fields.summary: Ability to Bulk Change Email Domain on Users

fields.description:
At the moment, all site-admins of the instance will receive notification when a new user has self sign-up.

An email similar to this one is sent and a banner is displayed for all site-admins until all invites are either dismissed or accepted.

 !Screen Shot 2017-08-21 at 11.09.24 AM.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2017-07-17 at 1.26.29 PM (1).png|thumbnail! 

*Suggestion*

Add a switch in the User management section > Self-signup so site-admins can choose whether or not be notified upon user's sign-up.

*Note*: Clicking on the "X" will dismiss the banner for an hour.
fields.summary: Add a switch for site-admins to take off the banner and auto email upon a user self sign-up

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 - Since the introduction of Atlassian account, administrators are unable to update the email address on "customer" or "contractor" JIRA accounts.
 - As these accounts are usually on domains out of the JIRA admin's control - Domain Verification is not an option.
 - Due to the fact that Domain Verification is not an option, when a JIRA admin needs to update an email address - usually the only option is to delete and recreate the JIRA account with the same username(preserve user contributions), but with an updated email address.
 - Please note that this is not in reference to JIRA Service Desk. It's quite common for JIRA admins to grant edit access to external people/contractors/customers.
 - Having to remember group memberships, or using trial and error to get a previously existing user's access back can create quite a bit of extra overhead for the JIRA admin.

h3. Suggested Solution
 - When recreating a user by specifying a username that already exists, after a confirmation screen presented to the JIRA admin, JIRA is then able to automatically add the recreated user to the user groups previously associated with that account.

h3. Why this is important
 - With the introduction of Atlassian account, many customers have had to change the email address for their users who are external contractors or customers. For either technical or political reasons, some end users are unable to make this change themselves. This causes friction between internal and external parties.

h3. Workaround
 - Manually add the user back to the appropriate user groups.
fields.summary: Automatic user group memberships when recreating a JIRA account

fields.description:
Hi team,

 

Customer created a ticket CA-310350, he also attatched a video of himself trying to change his photo but is unsuccessful



 
I have several developers in my team and I can't distinguish who's who because no one has their profile pic updated. One day everyone updated their profile pic but some people couldn't update at all (including myself). I was able to change my profile pic ONCE through many permutations and repetition. Now I can't change it back.

I've attached my user experience for changing profile pic. PLEASE fix this. This seems like a basic functionality that the users shouldn't have to think about.

 

[https://getsupport.atlassian.com/projects/CA/queues/custom/424/CA-310350]

 

 

Please let me know if you need any more info
fields.summary: Customer can not change photo on id.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Example Scenario : If a customer has an existing JIRA Cloud instance and is importing a Server backup of Confluence (or the other way around) It will wipe out ALL existing users in the JIRA Cloud instance and replace them with the User data from the import.

h3. Customer Impact
Cases like this though infrequent, when it happens it causes a lot of pain and take a lot of time from the customers and from support. Customers are not able to login and there is no easy way for support to recover. Of Course we can recreate the users, this is fine with smaller instances but with bigger instances (1000+ users) we are talking about hours and hours of lost productivity for the Customers and hours taken away from the support engineer to handle 1 issue. 

With Unicorn (pre-idplat) - We can actually take the data from the daily backup and dump them back in Crowd but with the combination of Vertigo and Idplat, (users are not stored in the local instance database and restoring vertigo is not recommended) it makes the bad import workflow even worst. 


h3. Environment
* Cloud + Vertigo + Idplat

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add JIRA to a Confluence only instance
# Import JIRA backup into the instance

h3. Expected Results
# Users and Groups from both instances are merged 

h3. Actual Results
# Users/Groups from the existing instance are removed and replaced with the Users/Groups from the backup
fields.summary: Performing an Import for an Application on an existing Cloud instance will Remove ALL Users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Menu icon blocks Support menu item on iPhone 6s Safari browser:
 !upload.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to replicate

* Open id.atlassian.com in iPhone 6s safari browser



h3. Expected Behaviour

Menu icon should not block the support menu icon.
fields.summary: Menu icon blocks Support menu item on iPhone 6s Safari browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to update the billing contact from User Management, it throws the error:
{quote}
Something went wrong while trying to manage your billing contact. Please try again later.
{quote}

h3. Environment
* Cloud Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *!https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/444107050/cog.png!> Billing*
# Choose *Payment details*
# Click on *Manage billing contacts*

h3. Expected Results
# Make the billing contact fields editable; *OR*
# Redirect user to https://my.atlassian.com/ to update the main billing contact

h3. Actual Results
Error throws: 
!Billing   Payment details.jpg|thumbnail!  
!Billing   Payment details 1.jpg|thumbnail! 

*Application logs:*
* No error found on the logs.
* Error 500 on Development Tool
{code}
Request URL:https://example.atlassian.net/admin/rest/billing/api/instance/billing-contact
Request Method:POST
Status Code:500 
Remote Address:104.192.137.113:443
Referrer Policy:no-referrer-when-downgrade
{code}

h3.Workaround
Update via my.atlassian.com: [How can I change the billing and technical contacts for my Atlassian products?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/purchasing/how-can-i-change-the-billing-and-technical-contacts-for-my-atlassian-products-432802239.html]
fields.summary: Unable to Manage Billing Contact

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Current credential are stored and expires after 30 days and there is no ability to reduce the number or set to 0 days. There is an existing feature request [ID-86|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ID-86] to have this ability however, it hasn't been looked at for years. Some cases which will cause problem is where users are using public computer to access the application, it would be a security risk if the users forgot to log out and someone else uses the computer and access the application. 

h3. Suggestion
Allow an option to disable auto-login feature thus user must enter credential each time a different person logs into the computer.
fields.summary: Disable auto-login for use on public computers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When Google Apps Users are synced, the administrator can only tell if a user was synced from Google Apps if there is an option to edit the user in Google Apps. 
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be helpful to have another section under Google Apps settings that shows the list of users who were specifically synced from Google
h3. Why this is important

Improves User Management and ease of use
fields.summary: Improve User Management by showing a list of Google Apps Synced Users

fields.description:
h4. Documentation
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-editing-and-deleting-users-794198944.html

h4. Information to add
- Please add the information that when an user is deleted, his contributions (historical data) are kept and can be reutilised if another user is created using the same username, like said on the delete screen on User Management, this is unclear to users until they decide to click on Delete Account.
fields.summary: Update the creating, editing and delete users documentation for the delete user action.

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When a customer deletes an Atlassian Account on AID (id.atlassian.com), the account linked to it on a JIRA/Confluence Cloud instance will still exist, broken, when another Atlassian Account is created or has its email changed to match the account on JIRA/Confluence Cloud email, it does not update the Atlassian ID to match the new Atlassian Account, it keeps the old Atlassian ID, not associating it.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Have an user created on an instance using emailA@test.com
# Delete this Atlassian Account on email emailA@test.com
# Change another Atlassian Account or create a new one with the emailA@test.com
# Log in to the JIRA/Confluence Cloud instance with the emailA@test.com

h5. Expected Behaviour

User has access to the instance as before.

h5. Actual Result

Error thrown on the UI: "Your email address emailA@test.com doesn't have access to <instance>.atlassian.net"

h4. Notes

The situation showed up a case where customers still impacted by the Atlassian Account migration, had two accounts created, email@olddomain.com (On BitBucket) and email@newdomain.com (On JIRA/Confluence) and they tried to unify them by removing the one with the new domain so they could change the email on the current user's Atlassian Account to use the new domain email.

h4. Workaround

The JIRA/Confluence Cloud user account can be deleted and re-created using the same username in order to keep the historical data, use this create user page in order to be able to customise the username (by standard, the username will be automatically generated using the email's prefix. ie: charlie@domain.com, username: charlie).
- https://<instance>.atlassian.net/admin/users/add
fields.summary: Atlassian Account not associating with existing user account on JIRA/Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
Some users would like to designate several email addresses on their Atlassian account specifically for site-specific notifications. This allows them to have a single identity that they can use as they work with different organizations across their careers, instead of having to spin up separate accounts with distinct full name, avatar, and other settings for each engagement.

This request is particularly popular with Bitbucket users, as this model is in use by some other popular dev tools products. In fact, this request is currently the 13th-highest voted issue for Bitbucket with nearly 500 votes and many comments that can be read here: https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/7038/custom-email-routing-bb-8197
fields.summary: Allow multiple email addresses to be associated with a single Atlassian account

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 22 July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

I have some good news! My team has released a last_active field for managed accounts in the [Organization API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/]. The get users in an org [endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/#api-orgs-orgId-users-get] provides further documentation of this process.

This API will provide last active date information for managed accounts, which means you must have an organization and a verified domain. An "organization" is a unified view of the sites and products that your company is using. You can check if you have an organization already by visiting [admin.atlassian.com|http://admin.atlassian.com/]. You should see a list of your organizations under "Organizations."

If you don't have an organization, you can create one by following the directions on [this doc|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-up-an-atlassian-organization-938859734.html].

Once you have an organization created, you'll need to claim a domain, which can be done by following the instructions [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/verify-a-domain-for-your-organization-873871234.html].

After claiming a domain, you should be able to follow the directions on the Organization API [documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/organization/rest/] to get last_active data for your managed accounts.

I hope this is helpful. Please let me know if these directions are unclear or if any additional questions arrive. Thank you for voting and commenting on this issue, and we remain committed to improving the functionality of our REST APIs.

Thanks,
 Rak Garg
 [rgarg@atlassian.com|mailto:rgarg@atlassian.com]
 Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}

 
h3. Problem Definition

With the introduction of [Per User Pricing for Atlassian Cloud - Atlassian|https://www.atlassian.com/licensing/cloud/future-pricing] Automating tracking for last active users is important for our Customers to manage and audit their users and to check the accuracy of the billing from Atlassian.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the Last Active Date as a field in the REST API endpoint /rest/api/2/user
h3. Workaround

No Workaround for automation, to get the Last Active Date customers are referring to the information in User Management.
fields.summary: Include 'Last Active Date' as a field in REST API endpoint /rest/api/2/user

fields.description: Once we have verified a domain, it would be great if we can see the list of users under the domain that we have verified in https://id.atlassian.com/ and it would be great if we can manage them as well.
fields.summary: Give Administrators the Ability to be Able to do Account Management on https://id.atlassian.com for their verified domain

fields.description: As an admin, I would like to edit the username through user management, since in G Suite this option is not available.
fields.summary: Ability to edit username in user management when instance is integrated with G Suite
